document_title: Allergic rhinitis: Causes, signs and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Is allergic rhinitis dangerous? Untreated allergic rhinitis can cause complications such as degeneration of the nasal mucosa, edema causing nasal congestion; The nasal turbinates are hyperplastic and interspersed with polyp degeneration; ulcerative inflammation of the nasal vestibule; pharyngitis, bronchitis; Sinusitis; otitis media.
Complications of bronchitis can be dangerous for young children if not treated promptly. Bronchitis can spread to the lungs, causing pneumonia and respiratory failure, threatening the child's life.
